info.title: DX User and Group Management REST API
info.description:
The remote PUMA SPI gives you access to user profiles through REST services. It provides a remote interface for user and group management for the configured Portal user repository. It is based on the REST (REpresentational State Transfer) architecture model.

The remote REST service for PUMA allows you to remotely perform the following tasks related to user and group data based on the HTTP protocol:
Access, retrieve, and modify information about available user or group attributes and their metadata
Search for users or groups based on attributes or group membership
Create, update, or delete user or group profiles and group membership relations. 

In case virtual Portals are used the virtual Portal can be specified by adding the query parameter ?virtualPortal to the URL of the API explorer with the value of the virtual Portal URL context - for example http://localhost:10039/dx/api/users/v1/explorer/?virtualPortal=myVirtualPortalContext  - all API calls will then have the virtual Portal context included in the URL. If you are using host based virtual Portals access the API explorer with the virtual Portal host.

/um/currentuser/profile.summary: This URI path operation returns or allows updating the profile of the current user.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

401.description: Access control check during request processing failed.

403.description: The operation that the client tries to perform is not possible. For example, this can be creating a user ID that already exists, setting attribute values for attributes that are not defined, or using mutually exclusive request parameters.

404.description: The URI does not match any of the defined URI paths or a variable part of a defined URI path does not denote a resource that exists.

405.description: The request addresses a defined URI, but uses an HTTP method that is not defined for this URI.

415.description: The format specified in the mime-type URI parameter or accept headers is not supported.

get.summary: This URI path operation returns the profile of the current user.
get.description: If this operation is performed without authentication, the profile of the anonymous user is returned. This URI path operation has no query parameter.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

401.description: Access control check during request processing failed.

403.description: The operation that the client tries to perform is not possible. For example, this can be creating a user ID that already exists, setting attribute values for attributes that are not defined, or using mutually exclusive request parameters.

404.description: The URI does not match any of the defined URI paths or a variable part of a defined URI path does not denote a resource that exists.

405.description: The request addresses a defined URI, but uses an HTTP method that is not defined for this URI.

415.description: The format specified in the mime-type URI parameter or accept headers is not supported.

put.summary: This URI path operation updates the profile of the current user.

/um/users/profiles.summary: Returns the list of users based on query parameters for GET and creation of users.
/um/users/profiles.description:
This URI path operation returns the list of references to all user profiles that correspond to the search criteria and other parameters. If there are no limiting parameters, all available users are returned. The list that is returned is access control filtered for the current user. 
It also allows the creation of new users.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: The attributes contained in the profiles are limited to those specified in the comma-separated list provided by this attribute. By default, if you omit this parameter, the basic set of attributes is returned for users, or the minimum set of attributes is returned for groups.

parameters.name: memberOf
parameters.description:
The response contains only profiles of users or groups that a are member of the specified group.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: showNested
parameters.description: If you set the memberOf parameter, this parameter specifies whether nested groups are considered or not. If you set the parameter to false, only direct membership is evaluated. The default value is false.

parameters.name: searchAttributes
parameters.description:
Use this query parameter to define a search string that specifies various combinations of attribute values as search criteria. All implementations have to support at least values such as attribute name and attribute value, where the attribute value can contain an asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard character.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description:
The returned list will contain only the one user with the specified unique identifier. The implementation decides what is to be used as the unique identifier. For example, this can be the distinguished name.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: resultsPerPage
parameters.description:
The returned list will contain only the given number of results. Additionally, links to additional result pages (first, last, next, previous) will be included in the response, if available.
Paged search (resultsPerPage) only works for searchAttributes.

parameters.name: sortByAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list that specifies the sort order for the results. This is only supported for a paged search.

parameters.name: descending
parameters.description: Determines if the sorting according to sortByAttributes will be descending.

parameters.name: expandrefs
parameters.description: If you set this to true, the complete profiles are embedded in the references. The default is false.

post.description: Creates a user via DX in the backend system.

/um/groups/profiles.summary: Returns the list of groups based on query parameters for GET and creation of groups.
/um/groups/profiles.description:
This URI path operation returns the list of references to all group profiles that correspond to the search criteria and other parameters. If there are no limiting parameters, all available groups are returned. The list that is returned is access control filtered for the current group. 
It also allows the creation of new groups.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: The attributes contained in the profiles are limited to those specified in the comma-separated list provided by this attribute. By default, if you omit this parameter, the minimum set of attributes is returned for groups.

parameters.name: memberOf
parameters.description:
The response contains only profiles of groups that a are member of the specified group.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: showNested
parameters.description: If you set the memberOf parameter, this parameter specifies whether nested groups are considered or not. If you set the parameter to false, only direct membership is evaluated. The default value is false.

parameters.name: searchAttributes
parameters.description:
Use this query parameter to define a search string that specifies various combinations of attribute values as search criteria. All implementations have to support at least values such as attribute name and attribute value, where the attribute value can contain an asterisk ( * ) as a wildcard character.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: identifier
parameters.description:
The returned list will contain only the one group with the specified unique identifier. The implementation decides what is to be used as the unique identifier. For example, this can be the distinguished name.
The parameters memberOf, searchAttributes, and identifier are mutually exclusive.

parameters.name: resultsPerPage
parameters.description:
The returned list will contain only the given number of results. Additionally, links to additional result pages (first, last, next, previous) will be included in the response, if available.
Paged search (resultsPerPage) only works for searchAttributes.

parameters.name: sortByAttributes
parameters.description: Comma-separated list that specifies the sort order for the results. This is only supported for a paged search.

parameters.name: descending
parameters.description: Determines if the sorting according to sortByAttributes will be descending.

parameters.name: expandrefs
parameters.description: If you set this to true, the complete profiles are embedded in the references. The default is false.

get.summary: Returns the list of groups based on query parameters.
get.description: This URI path operation returns the list of references to all group profiles that correspond to the search criteria and other parameters. If there are no limiting parameters, all available groups are returned. The list that is returned is access control filtered for the current group.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

403.description: The operation that the client tries to perform is not possible. For example, this can be creating a group ID that already exists, setting attribute values for attributes that are not defined, or using mutually exclusive request parameters.

post.description: Creates a group via DX in the backend system.

/um/users/profiles/{userID}.description: This URI path operation returns or updates or deletes a representation of the user profile.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: The attributes contained in the profiles are limited to those specified in the comma-separated list provided by this attribute. By default, if you omit this parameter, all attributes that hold values are returned.

parameters.name: userID
parameters.description: The user id.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

get.description: This URI path operation returns a representation of the user profile. For details refer to the topic about the payload description.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description:
This defines how the update is performed. Valid values are as follows:
replace
All attribute values provided in the update replace the existing ones. This is the default.
merge
The new attribute values are merged with existing ones. This is only relevant for multi-value attributes.
delete
The values of all attributes provided in the update are removed from the profile. Consequently, the actual attribute values given in the update are ignored.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

put.description: This URI path operation updates the user profile with the profile representation contained in the request body. Only the attributes provided in this representation are considered, therefore post only the attributes that you want to change.

parameters.name: groupID
parameters.description: The group id.

parameters.name: expandRefs
parameters.description: If you set this to true, the complete profiles are embedded in the references. The default is false.

parameters.name: includeAttributes
parameters.description: The attributes contained in the profiles are limited to those specified in the comma-separated list provided by this attribute. By default, if you omit this parameter, the basic set of attributes is returned for users, or the minimum set of attributes is returned for groups.

parameters.name: showNested
parameters.description: This parameter specifies whether nested groups are considered or not. If you set the parameter to false, only direct membership is evaluated. The default value is false.

get.description: This URI path operation returns the list of references to all group profiles of the groups of which the user or the group is a member.

parameters.name: update
parameters.description:
This defines how the update is performed. Possible values are as follows:
replace
The complete membership list will be replaced by the one posted. This is the default.
merge
The user or group are added to the groups contained in the posted membership list in addition to the existing group membership relations of the user or group.
delete
The user or group will be removed from all the groups contained in the posted list only.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

401.description: Access control check during request processing failed.

403.description: The operation that the client tries to perform is not possible. For example, this can be creating a group ID that already exists, setting attribute values for attributes that are not defined, or using mutually exclusive request parameters.

404.description: The URI does not match any of the defined URI paths or a variable part of a defined URI path does not denote a resource that exists.

405.description: The request addresses a defined URI, but uses an HTTP method that is not defined for this URI.

415.description: The format specified in the mime-type URI parameter or accept headers is not supported.

put.description: This URI path operation updates the existing membership list for the user or group by the one that is posted.

400.description: The input provided in the request body does not comply to the expected format. For example, this can be invalid XML in a posted profile.

401.description: Access control check during request processing failed.

403.description: The operation that the client tries to perform is not possible. For example, this can be creating a group ID that already exists, setting attribute values for attributes that are not defined, or using mutually exclusive request parameters.

404.description: The URI does not match any of the defined URI paths or a variable part of a defined URI path does not denote a resource that exists.

405.description: The request addresses a defined URI, but uses an HTTP method that is not defined for this URI.

415.description: The format specified in the mime-type URI parameter or accept headers is not supported.

delete.description: This URI path operation deletes the membership list for the user or group; this means that it removes the user or group from all groups.

parameters.name: userOrGroupID
parameters.description: ID of the user or group.
